section.title: Requirements
section.p: The Jmol web browser applet runs on most browser Java Virtual Machines, including the Microsoft and Netscape 4.7* implementations of the Java 1.1 JVM.
If you are running Microsoft Internet Explorer on the Windows operating system we recommend that you upgrade to the Sun Java Virtual Machine by visiting www.java.com.
The standalone Jmol application requires Java 1.4 or higher. The latest Java 2 Platform Standard Edition is recommended.

section.title: Jmol v10 beta test program
section.p: If you are interested in participating in the Jmol v10 beta test then you can download it from here.

section.title: Downloading Jmol version 9
section.p: The current official release is version $VERSION$.

It can be downloaded using the following links:
jmol v$VERSION$
With some delay, binary and source packages are available, as well as Debian GNU/Linux (see below), and Suse/RedHat Linux packages.

Debian users can also apt-get the package from debian.wgdd.de/ by adding:
deb http://ftp.wgdd.de/debian unstable main contrib non-free deb-src http://ftp.wgdd.de/debian unstable main contrib non-free
to /etc/apt/sources.list, and doing 'apt-get update && apt-get install jmol/unstable'. The repository has changed, because mentors.debian.net will no longer provide binary-packages.

section.title: Downloading the applet
section.p: To use the applet, you must first download the applet distribution and extract the files. It can be downloaded from SourceForge.
JmolApplet.jar contains all the classes needed to support the Jmol applet. No other jar files are needed.
